title: grunge/destructive fonts needed
content:
Hi there,

would be cool if you could let me know about fonts in the following style. Well those which I found are ok but not perfect:

[http://www.dafont.com/defused.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215104233/http:/www.dafont.com/defused.font "http://www.dafont.com/defused.font")  
 [http://www.dafont.com/disintegration.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215104233/http:/www.dafont.com/disintegration.font "http://www.dafont.com/disintegration.font")  
 [http://www.dafont.com/decrepit.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215104233/http:/www.dafont.com/decrepit.font "http://www.dafont.com/decrepit.font")

Should work for a metal logo.

Cheers, Andreas
author: godisatheist

comments.content:
If it's just for a logo couldn't you grunge up an existing font you like the structure of? In the past I have scanned coffee grounds, photocopied things down multiple generations, taken rubbings off concrete. S'good fun

--N

...or try this technique to digitally grungify a typeface you already own:

[http://www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/tip-the-wornweatheredstamped-l...](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215104233/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/tip-the-wornweatheredstamped-look/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/tip-the-wornweatheredstamped-look/")

Device has a lot of this kind of typefaces,  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/browse.aspx?vendor=DET&page=&view=new](http://web.archive.org/web/20111215104233/http:/www.veer.com/products/browse.aspx?vendor=DET&page=&view=new "http://www.veer.com/products/browse.aspx?vendor=DET&page=&view=new")

Pieter
